44.title: Tank McNamara
44.author: Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The object of the game is to know sports statistics that will put everyone else to sleep.

45.title: Tank McNamara
45.author: by Millar-Hinds.
45.series: Aug. 29, 1984) "Sorry I'm Late for Practice, Coach. Lab Experiment Wouldn't go Right"*

46.title: Tank McNamara
46.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Vine-Covered University, home of the last student-athlete football program, is showing football players taking physics exams as a tourist attraction.

47.title: Tank McNamara
47.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Open auditions for cable color commentators.

48.title: Tank McNamara
48.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The United States Football League commissioner gives his state-of-the-league address.

49.title: Tank McNamara
49.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: A dream about the NBA playoff formula that prolongs the season by not eliminating any teams.

50.title: Tank McNamara
50.author: Millar-Hinds.
50.series: June 10, 1986) "He's Been Mowing Both our Neighbors' Yards for Three Years and Hasn't Realized It Yet"*
notes: Summary: Shopping for a Father's Day gift; it seems he already has a television set attached to his lawnmower.

51.title: Tank McNamara
51.author: by Millar-Hinds.
51.series: Sept. 1, 1988) "Above the Law in the College Town"*
notes: Summary: People (a nun, an old man with a cane, and a little boy) are getting traffic tickets for obstructing football players in traffic.

52.title: Tank McNamara
52.author: by Jeff Millar & Bill Hinds
52.appears_in: reproduced on p. 135 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Dad explains the golf term, as the family car is towed up by a wrecker.

53.title: Tank McNamara
53.author: by Millar-Hinds.
53.series: Jan. 26, 1989) "Progressive Brain Atrophy Can Affect Both Those Who Talk About Sports and Those Who Passively Listen"*

54.title: Tank McNamara
54.author: Millar-Hinds.
54.series: Jan. 15, 1991) "They're Famous for Breaking their Fans' Hearts in Playoff Games"*
notes: Summary: Don't get your hopes up for the Smashers.

55.title: Tank McNamara
55.author: Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: A 23-year-old third baseman making $3 million a year visits a liquor store in the middle of the night before a game.

56.title: Tank McNamara
56.author: Millar-Hinds.
56.series: Aug. 21, 1991) "Each Guy Gets the Cotton-Candy Sales for His Section"*
notes: Summary: What's the pay in arena football?

57.title: Tank McNamara
57.author: by Millar-Hinds.
57.series: Aug. 24, 1991) "This is a Non-NFL, Non-WLAF Market, Dobbs. Life's Cheap Down Here"*
notes: Summary: Dobbs is signed up for arena football, where there's a wall two feet from the out-of-bounds line.

58.title: Tank McNamara
58.author: by Millar-Hinds.
58.series: Sept. 28, 1991) "We Don't Raise the Bridge, We Lower the Water"*
notes: Summary: An English class of third-year college athletes is learning to spell "Shakespeare."

59.title: Tank McNamara
59.author: Millar-Hinds.
59.series: Oct. 2, 1991) "Those Ridiculous Academic Standards are Killing the Football Program"*
notes: Summary: The team has a 22-game losing streak, and Vine-Covered has just been named one of the five best universities in the country.

60.title: Tank McNamara
60.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The Rolex bandit was caught with five $15,000 watches; could this be connected with the fact the Enormous State University basketball team is in town?

61.title: Tank McNamara
61.author: by Millar-Hinds.
61.series: Apr. 17, 1992) "There's a Plane Out of Here at 4:20"*
notes: Summary: Players way behind in the tournament decide to hurry up and finish the round.

62.title: Tank McNamara
62.author: by Millar-Hinds.
62.series: Apr. 18, 1992) "People Paid Good Money to See Your Best Golf"*
notes: Summary: Two pros are having fun, playing as fast as they can.

63.title: Tank McNamara
63.author: by Millar-Hinds.
63.series: May 16, 1992) "State of the Art for State of the Art's Sake"*
notes: Summary: The football players have little dish antennas on their helmets.

64.title: Tank McNamara
64.author: Millar-Hinds.
64.series: June 6, 1992) "It's for the Future of the Game"*
notes: Summary: The networks are losing money, so they're passing the hat in the ballpark.

65.title: Tank McNamara
65.author: by Millar-Hinds.
65.series: Aug. 1, 1992) "Back from Barcelona : U.S. Men's Basketball Team"
notes: Summary: Larry Bird is resting his back.

66.title: Tank McNamara
66.author: by Millar-Hinds.
66.series: Aug. 24, 1992) "Worldwide Reaction to our Official 1996 Olympic Mascot"*
notes: Summary: The Atlanta Olympic Committee finds that the world doesn't like their mascot.

67.title: Tank McNamara
67.author: by Millar-Hinds.
67.series: Sept. 18, 1992) "I Wish a Guy Could Declare his Batting Average Bankrupt if it Falls Below .200"*

68.title: Tank McNamara
68.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: A match is being set up between Conners and Navratilova; Jimmy won't be allowed to grunt.

69.title: Tank McNamara
69.author: by Millar-Hinds.
69.series: Feb. 20, 1993) "Final Effort in the NBA All-Star Weekend's Flagrant Foul Contest"*
notes: Summary: The contestant is Bill Laimbeer, and the judges are Sylvester Stallone, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Steven Seagal.

70.title: Tank McNamara
70.author: by Millar-Hinds.
70.series: Mar. 2, 1993) "The Stuffers Snuck Their Ballboy into the Game Against Us!"*
notes: Summary: A stunt like that disrespects the league and the game, but the ballboy did hit for 12.

71.title: Tank McNamara
71.author: Millar & Hinds.
71.series: Apr. 26, 1993) "Those Big Things, Like in the Beer Commercials"*
notes: Summary: A promoter is hoping the Kentucky Derby will be interested in TV money for a preliminary event like the Monster Truck contests, except with horses.

72.title: Tank McNamara
72.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Shaquille is trying to break the unbreakable backboard.

73.title: Tank McNamara
73.author: by Millar-Hinds.
73.series: June 4, 1993) "We Think This is Little Octavious"*
notes: Summary: Postal inspectors have a picture of Muggsy, a collectibles dealer, who wrote a letter saying he was a dying child to get a game jersey.

74.title: Tank McNamara
74.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The league has installed a tobacco checkpoint in the infield.

75.title: Tank McNamara
75.author: by Millar-Hinds.
75.series: July 8, 1993) "Easy, You'll Just Start Coughing Again"*
notes: Summary: Tobacco executives are trying to increase consumption among young people by associating the product with healthful outdoor activity, though they're worried the EPA might ban smoking in national parks.

76.title: Tank McNamara
76.author: by Millar-Hinds.
76.series: Oct. 23, 1993) "It's Like Gettin' Two Sports in One Game"*
notes: Summary: Not all fans object to fights on college football fields.

77.title: Tank McNamara
77.author: by Millar-Hinds.
77.series: Oct. 28, 1993) "What Kid Wants to Play in Front of 10,000 Empty Seats?"*
notes: Summary: The ESU athletic director doesn't want his games telecast because it hurts recruiting.

78.title: Tank McNamara
78.author: by Millar-Hinds.
78.series: Nov. 6, 1993) "I Got Troopers in the Parking Lot on Standby"*
notes: Summary: Rival football teams are in a status competition based on how many state troopers are guarding their coaches.

79.title: Tank McNamara
79.author: by Millar-Hinds.
79.series: Dec. 7, 1993) "I Dreamed that our Record was so Bad the Team Physician Quit in Disgust and the Front Office Hired Dr. Kevorkian!"*

80.title: Tank McNamara
80.author: by Millar-Hinds.
80.series: Jan. 1, 1994) "Couldn't They Play Them All at Once and Call it the Fruit Salad Bowl?"*

81.title: Tank McNamara
81.author: by Millar-Hinds.
81.series: Jan. 26, 1994) "The Game's in Georgia. How About We Bet 20 Pounds of Peaches?"*
notes: Summary: The mayors of super bowl cities traditionally make silly bets.

82.title: Tank McNamara
82.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The U.S. figure skating has an alternate in case any of the women is indicted or sleeps with the fishes.

83.title: Tank McNamara
83.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: IRS agents divide up audits, and the pitcher for the Bashers is a hot one.

84.title: Tank McNamara
84.author: by Millar-Hinds.
84.series: Mar. 25, 1994) "Most People Would Consider Selling Your Autograph Stealing and Not Income"*
notes: Summary: The I.R.S. requires athletes to report card-signing income.

85.title: Tank McNamara
85.author: by Millar-Hinds.
85.series: Apr. 11, 1994) "I Hear He's Building Stands in His Office"*
notes: Summary: The team owner doesn't think the public gives him enough credit.

86.title: Tank McNamara
86.author: by Millar-Hinds.
86.series: Apr. 29, 1994) "Threatening to Move the Franchise Because..."*
notes: Summary: The taxpayers just built them a new stadium, so they need to find a new complaint.

87.title: Tank McNamara
87.author: by Millar-Hinds.
87.series: May 12, 1994) "Balls are Flying Out of the Ballparks at a Record Rate"*
notes: Summary: Either the balls are juiced, or the pitching quality is going down.

88.title: Tank McNamara
88.author: by Millar-Hinds.
88.series: May 27, 1994) "Have You Noticed the Gallery that John Daly Attracts?"*
notes: Summary: Young people are watching golf and cheering.

89.title: Tank McNamara
89.author: by Miller-Hinds.
89.series: Aug. 17, 1994) "Once the Contestants Learn that the Caber is Supposed to be Tossed Both Up and Away"*
notes: Summary: Auditions are in progress for a new sport on CBS, and the caber toss gets a try.

90.title: Tank McNamara
90.author: by Millar-Hinds.
90.series: Aug. 23, 1994) "You Aren't Understanding What I Mean by 'Hate.' I Hate Golf"*
notes: Summary: Joyce has a first-woman-ever vice presidency, which includes membership fees at her golf club.

91.title: Tank McNamara
91.author: by Millar-Hinds.
91.series: Sept. 2, 1994) "Has Anything Good Ever Happened to me on a Golf Course?"*
notes: Summary: Joyce and Tank are both in the woods looking for their balls, about to meet.

92.title: Tank McNamara
92.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Masters tournament officials are trying to hire the Lion King as a golf commentator, to make it sound sacred.
Entry for: James Earl Jones.

93.title: Tank McNamara
93.author: by Millar-Hinds.
93.series: Oct. 10, 1994) "If You Told Me When I Was In College that I'd Ever Go Out with a Guy Who Played Football"*
notes: Summary: She's used to dating "business-world piranhas," and at this point can't even remember Tank's name, but she likes him.

94.title: Tank McNamara
94.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Scene from "Angels in the Outfield II : A World Series After All," commenting on player salary demands and high ticket prices.

95.title: Tank McNamara
95.author: by Millar-Hinds.
95.series: Nov. 9, 1994) "Three in the Game but 2.7 in the Record Books"*
notes: Summary: Alumni legends are on the basketball court protesting 3-point shots, and the league compromises.

96.title: Tank McNamara
96.author: by Millar-Hinds.
96.series: Apr. 7, 1995) "Last Week We Wanted You to Think We Played Baseball for Fun"*
notes: Summary: A little boy asks why autographs cost money this week.

97.title: Tank McNamara
97.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Attendance is down, and the owner wants more promotions. Fans have suggestions.

98.title: Tank McNamara
98.author: by Millar-Hinds.
98.series: June 12, 1995) "Build a Stadium Ourselves, Without Taxpayer Money"*
notes: Summary: The owners are afraid they might have to finance their own facilities in Los Angeles.

99.title: Tank McNamara
99.author: by Millar-Hinds.
99.series: Dec. 30, 1995) "No College Player Seeded in the Top 10 Rounds of a Pro Draft Can Be Prosecuted"*
notes: Summary: A state law grants athletic immunity during the bowl season.

100.title: Tank McNamara
100.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: George Bailey from the bank turns up, having started a software company.
Key words: Owners, teams, Jimmy Stewart, It's a Wonderful Life. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Stewart"

101.title: Tank McNamara
101.author: Millar-Hinds.
101.series: July 29, 1997) "Just Somethin' called an Operating System"*
notes: Summary: George buys the team from Satan with his debit card, and is asked what kind of software he's developed to get so rich.
Key words: ATMs, owners, wealth, Jimmy Stewart, Bill Gates, It's a Wonderful Life.

102.title: Tank McNamara
102.author: Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: George sells the team that the owners had threatened to move, to the people of Bedford Falls for a buck.
Key words: Jimmy Stewart, It's a Wonderful Life.

103.title: Tank McNamara
103.author: Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The Smashers' general manager looks like an idiot after his car is stolen by a new player with a criminal record from college.

104.title: Tank McNamara
104.author: Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The no. 1 draft pick with the criminal record has stolen the general manager's car and his parking place.
Key words: Car theft. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Criminal Records"

105.title: Tank McNamara
105.author: Millar-Hinds.
105.series: Aug. 2, 1997) "He's Not Holding Out, He's Holding Up"*
notes: Summary: The new player has a gun pointed at the other players in the locker room. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Locker Rooms"

106.title: Tank McNamara
106.author: by Millar-Hinds.
106.series: Oct. 2, 1997) "Getting the Number Right is a More Significant Indicator of Neural Stability"*
notes: Summary: The team neurologist holds up two fingers and the player sees two fish.

107.title: Tank McNamara
107.author: by Millar-Hinds.
107.series: Nov. 14, 1997) "When They Get Knocked on Their Behinds, They're Sitting Only on What the Good Lord Gave 'Em"*
notes: Summary: Women in a class called NFL 101 ask the teacher about the padding in football uniforms.

108.title: Tank McNamara
108.author: by Millar-Hinds.
108.series: June 10, 1998) "Metal Woods? Why, the Very Expression is an Oxymoron"*
notes: Summary: There's a Mostly Ancient Golf Association rule against oxymorons, in the same paragraph that deals with stagecoach wheels.

109.title: Tank McNamara
109.author: by Millar-Hinds.
109.series: June 12, 1998) "Every Wife Find Out on TV Her Husband is Transvestite?"*
notes: Summary: Tank's blind date has given the translator the night off; she's learning English from afternoon TV.

110.title: Tank McNamara
110.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: The Viagra competitor wants to do a before and after advertising campaign, and they need a former pro athlete whose image was, well..

111.title: Tank McNamara
111.author: by Millar-Hinds.
111.series: July 25, 1998) "The Endorser Has to Demonstrate a Genuine Need for the Product"*
notes: Summary: Before Rocky Palmquist becomes spokesman for the new Viagra rival, he should know that the FDA can be real sticklers.

112.title: Tank McNamara
112.author: by Millar-Hinds.
112.series: Nov. 7, 1998) "With Block Letters and a Little Heart over the 'i'"*
notes: Summary: She signed a contract at age seven, to wear a brand of tennis shoes that are destroying her feet.

113.title: Tank McNamara
113.author: by Millar-Hinds.
113.series: Mar. 12, 1999) "The Winds are Famously Tricky on This Course"*
notes: Summary: If McDivot makes the putt, Tiger Woods doesn't play and the ratings are in the toilet; military stealth technology goes into play.

114.title: Tank McNamara
114.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: McDivot makes the cut and Tiger Woods doesn't, until a hand in the sleeve of a business suit reaches up from inside the hole to block the putt.

115.title: Tank McNamara
115.author: by Millar-Hinds.
115.series: June 15, 1999) "You Don't Take Andro for Strength, You Take Andro to Speed Recovery from Minor Injuries"*
notes: Summary: The Journal of the American Medical Association finds no difference in strength between two groups of men.

116.title: Tank McNamara
116.author: by Millar-Hinds.
116.series: July 19, 1999) "The Sponsor Expects the Caddies to Wear Chill-Out Bibs"*
notes: Summary: The golf tournament is sponsored by an anti-freeze company, which has giant anti-freeze bottles for the caddies to wear.

117.title: Tank McNamara
117.author: by Millar-Hinds.
117.series: July 20, 1999) "The Record-Breaking Heat is Hard on Everyone at the Chill-Out Open"*

118.title: Tank McNamara
118.author: by Millar-Hinds.
118.series: July 21, 1999) "You Think We could Make the Caddie Bibs Optional?"*
notes: Summary: It's hot out and the people are dropping all over the course. References to golfers David Duval and Fuzzy Zeller.

119.title: Tank McNamara
119.author: by Millar-Hinds.
119.series: July 22, 1999) "Caddies are Collapsing Left and Right Because of your Chill-Out 'Bibs'"*
notes: Summary: The sponsor leaves the shade long enough to pour his drink on one of the caddies.

120.title: Tank MacNamara
120.author: by Jeff Millar and Bill Hinds.
120.series: July 24, 1999) "A Guy Has to Start Somewhere, Right?"*
notes: Summary: Two golfers, wearing their endorsement hats, look askance at the new guy whose shirt says, 'Chico's Bail Bonds.'

121.title: Tank McNamara
121.author: by Millar-Hinds.
121.series: July 28, 1999) "This isn't as, umm, Spontaneous as it Used to be"*
notes: Summary: Commentary on women who win events and remove their blouses to show Nike sports bras. A tennis player, a golfer, and a whole basketball team are shown.

122.title: Tank McNamara
122.author: by Millar-Hinds.

218.heading: Tanks.
218.title: "T.N.T. Spotlight!"
218.author: Robert Kanigher, script ; Mort Drucker, art
218.appears_in: 13 p. in Star Spangled War Stories, no. 87 (Nov. 1959).
notes: Summary: Behind the lines in occupied France, the Maqui Mlle. Marie plans a diversionary action in support of a reconnaissance by British Rangers, while the Nazi occupation troops under Commandant Von Ekt try to locate her broadcasting position. Failing at that, the Nazis take hostages from the local village, and Marie promptly frees them. Von Ekt then posts a challenge, about a trainload of tanks, and accidentally times it just right for the needed diversion. Marie is captured and put on the train, but she escapes and blows it up just in time to cover the Ranger landing.
Data from Mike Tiefenbacher via Grand Comic-Book Database Project.

notes: SUMMARY: The Saint is called to Libya to investigate an Italian secret weapon, which turns out to be tanks that burrow under the desert.

226.heading: Tanks.
226.title: "Wingmate of Doom!"
226.author: Robert Kanigher, script ; Jerry Grandenetti, art
226.appears_in: 13 p. in All American Men of War, no. 90 (Mar./Apr. 1962).
notes: Summary: Johnny leaves his patrol when Tex spots an unknown Mustang about to be ambushed by a Messerschmitt. It turns out the Mustang pilot didn't need help, but when Johnny returns to his flight it's surrounded by German fighters. Johnny's unexpected return saves the day, and back at the base the new pilot reports. His name is Lt. Tom Talon, and like Cloud he is Native American. The other pilots observe the meeting of the two men with these comments: "Look at the dead-pan way those two are looking at each other!" "Just like Indians! Never showing what they feel!" We learn that as boys the two men played together on the reservation, and that Talon's brother died during one of their games and Cloud is unfairly blamed for the death. Talon has sworn to kill Cloud, though the other men don't know this. On the next mission Johnny Cloud makes Talon his wingman, demoting a disapproving Tex to no. 3. Talon saves Cloud's life after first putting it in jeopardy. The next day Cloud saves Talon's life nearly at the expense of his own, and lands barely alive in enemy territory. Talon lands to pick him up, and they make it to safety even though being fired upon by a German tank. Talon considers the fact that Cloud saved his life to be payment of the debt for his brother's life.
Data from Bob Klein, via Grand Comics Database Project.
